Summary|url=http://pubchem.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/summary/summary.cgi?cid=19463&loc=ec_rcs|work=PubChem Compound|publisher=National Center for Biotechnology Information|accessdate=17 March 2012|location=USA|date=27 March 2005|at=Identification}}</ref> | OtherNames = ''N''-Ethyl-''N''-hydroxy-ethanamine{{citation needed|date=June 2012}} | Section1 = {{chembox Identifiers | CASNo = 3710-84-7 | CASNo_Ref = {{cascite|correct|CAS}} | PubChem = 19463 | PubChem_Ref = {{pubchemcite|correct|pubchem}} | ChemSpiderID = 18340 | ChemSpiderID_Ref = {{chemspidercite|correct|chemspider}} | UNII = 314I05EDVH | UNII_Ref = {{fdacite|correct|FDA}} | EINECS = 223-055-4 | UNNumber = 1993 | MeSHName = N,N-diethylhydroxylamine | RTECS = NC3500000 | Beilstein = 1731349 | SMILES = CCN(O)CC | StdInChI = 1S/C4H11NO/c1-3-5(6)4-2/h6H,3-4H2,1-2H3 | StdInChI_Ref = {{stdinchicite|correct|chemspider}} | StdInChIKey = FVCOIAYSJZGECG-UHFFFAOYSA-N | StdInChIKey_Ref = {{stdinchicite|correct|chemspider}} }} | Section2 = {{chembox Properties | C = 4 | H = 11 | N = 1 | O = 1 | Appearance = Colorless liquid | Odor = Ammoniacal | Density = 867 mg mL<sup>−1</sup> | MeltingPtCL = -26 | MeltingPtCH = -25 | BoilingPtK = 400.7 | Solubility = Miscible | VaporPressure = 500 Pa (at 0 °C) }} | Section3 = {{chembox Thermochemistry | DeltaHf = −175.47–−174.03 kJ mol<sup>−1</sup> | DeltaHc = −2.97201–−2.97069 MJ mol<sup>−1</sup> | HeatCapacity = 370.8 J K<sup>−1</sup> mol<sup>−1</sup> }} | Section4 = {{chembox Hazards | GHSPictograms = {{gHS flame}} {{gHS exclamation mark}} | GHSSignalWord = '''WARNING''' | HPhrases = {{h-phrases|226|312|315|319|332}} | PPhrases = {{p-phrases|280|305+351+338}} | EUClass = {{hazchem Xn}} | RPhrases = {{r10}}, {{r21}}, {{r38}} | SPhrases = {{r36/37}} | ExploLimits = 1.9–10% | LD50 = {{unbulleted list|1.3 g kg<sup>−1</sup> <small>(dermal, rabbit)</small>|2.19 g kg<sup>−1</sup> <small>(oral, rat)</small>}} }} | Section5 = {{chembox Related | Function = alkanols | OtherFunctn = {{unbulleted list|[[n-Methylethanolamine|''N''-Methylethanolamine]]|[[Dimethylethanolamine]]|[[Diethylethanolamine]]|[[Diethanolamine]]|[[n,N-Diisopropylaminoethanol|''N'',''N''-Diisopropylaminoethanol]]|[[Methyl diethanolamine]]|[[Triethanolamine]]|[[Bis-tris methane]]|[[Meglumine]]}} }} }} '''Diethylhydroxylamine''' (DEHA) is a chemical used in some [[plastics]]. As a [[free radical]] [[scavenger (chemistry)|scavenger]], it has five principal uses: #[[Polymerization]] [[Reaction inhibitor|inhibitor]] #Color stabilizer ([[photography|photographics]]) #Oxygen [[scavenger (chemistry)|scavenger]] ([[water treatment]]) #[[Corrosion inhibitor]] #Discoloration inhibitor ([[Phenolic resin|phenolics]]) ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:Plastics]] [[Category:Amines]] [[Category:Corrosion inhibitors]] {{amine-stub}}
